thread.title: Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest
thread.title_full: Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest

title: Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest
text:
Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest Las Vegas puts a record score forecast on Texas Tech vs Baylor Post to Facebook Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest Las Vegas puts a record score forecast on Texas Tech vs Baylor Check out this story on KVUE.com: http://kvue.tv/1RkC9Vb Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Vegas thinks Texas Tech vs. Baylor could be historic scoring fest KVUE 12:35 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Baylor Bears CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WACO -- The college football world knows Baylor and Texas Tech can pile up points like nobody else in the game. It appears Las Vegas oddsmakers believe the same thing and expect this weekend's game to be a historic scoring fest in Waco. 
According to KVUE news partner the Austin American-Statesman , Oddsharks placed the over/under for the game at 88.5 points. The over/under allows fans to bet on how many total points will be scored by both teams combined. The person betting can choose to bet the teams will score fewer than 88.5 points combined or more than 88.5 points. 
The previous record for a game also involved Baylor and was 88 in 2012 against Oklahoma State. 
Based on the first few games of the season, Baylor is averaging 64 points per game, tops in the nation, while Texas Tech is averaging 53.8 points per game. On the flip side, Baylor is giving up just 23 points per game, while Texas Tech is giving up 36 points per game, 108th in the nation out of 128 teams. 
In Texas Tech's last game, the team surrendered more than 700 yards of offense and gave up 55 points in the game. Conversely, in Baylor's last game, the Bears scored 70 points and racking up nearly 800 yards of offense in the game. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1RkC9Vb TOP VIDEOS
